Identifying Characteristics: Elongate fish with dorsal and anal fin located far back near the forked caudal fin
Jaws, tongue, and roof of mouth with many teeth
Operculum scaled on upper half only
5 pair of sensory pores along the underside of the lower jaw
Adults typically marked with oblong yellowish green spots positioned horizontally
Juveniles typically marked with pale colored wavy bars arranged vertically
Biology: Spawn in early spring shortly after or even prior to ice-out
Size: Pike exceeding 30 pounds have been caught in Maine
Habitat: Prefer shallow water habitat with dense stand of submerged aquatic vegetation
Range: Native Range: in the Northeast: Great Lakes and Allegheny drainages
Range: wide band through northern portion of North America, Europe, and Asia
